column1: sabpol,"2007-10-31T23:01:34.013Z","Wish I had more of these...","I bought this little set at a garage sale many years ago.  I regret it's my only Paradisa set.  Somehow, I don't seem to remember ever seeing these in the stores when LEGO came out with this series.
The gray, white, and pink bricks look great together.  There are several unique pieces in this set, like the parot, the green &quot
column3: , the sailboat platform, the sail itself, a cup, and an umbrella.  Female minifigs are more abundant in the Paradisa series than in any other LEGO theme, and there's a dark-haired female minifig wearing lipstick in this set.

column1: I think LEGO did a good job in making this series appeal to girls while not losing sight that it is still LEGO after all, not Barbie dolls or jewelry sets.  I wish LEGO would bring back Paradisa and get rid of the Bellville theme, which hardly looks like LEGO at all.",FALSE,5,0,0,0,0

column4: This set was definitely not picked out by me--- chances are it was bought for me and my female cousin to play with together. In my circle of AFOL friends, Paradisa is a somewhat elusive theme, but quite sought-after by a lot of City AFOLs. These sets carried the first pink bricks (if my&nbsp
column5: memory serves me right), and also possibly the largest amount of females in a single theme. Its target market is clear, and that's probably why alot of AFOLs didn't get these sets---as kids/teens we thought they were too ""girly"".

column9: minifig a good one to own. The male is your typical dude, nothing to write home about. Both are good additions to your bustling City, they just need a change of pants.

column4: The sailboard and mast are the eye catchers here. They still look great after all these years, and from what I see the sailboard is making a comback in the 2011 Harbour subtheme. There are no stickers, so that makes the umbrella/sunshade extra good. Thr rare pink chairs/cups/fences add variety to your collection, and you can never go wrong with more animals. The gray curved plates are also really useful in MOCing. A small but solid collection of pieces.
Not much of a build. It's built exactly like it looks. The sailboard is put together in a couple of steps.&nbsp
column5: The small boat was a bland and uninspiring build. The little rest station serves its purpose, but needs serious renovations to meet the more complicated build of sets today.

column4: I guess for its intended market it's good, but for me it's just part of the seaside diorama. Not really enough things to get the action going, I think.
Considering the Paradisa exclusive pink accessories and nice sailboard&nbsp
column7: pay up to about USD$12 for this set. However, I don't think you should search exclusively for this set, as the other Paradisa sets look much better than this one does.

column4:
A set that rides on the strength of its parts. The build is what you see. Pursue this set only if you are a collector or want the pink parts. Otherwise, you're not missing out on too much.
